scenario: Caterpillar's shares rose over 3% at the start of the trading week, outperforming the S&P 500's 0.2% gain. The increase was due to an analyst's recommendation upgrade from Evercore ISI's David Raso, who changed his view on the stock from underperform (sell) to in-line (hold) with a price target of $365 per share. Raso's new recommendation is based on factors such as double-digit declines in construction equipment stocks and better potential than anticipated, according to Evercore ISI's surveys. This is the second time in two months that Raso has shifted his view on Caterpillar, previously downgrading it from in-line to underperform. The article suggests cautious optimism for Caterpillar and the construction and construction-adjacent stocks, citing low interest rates and strong demand for housing.
